Name: MPI_Ssend
Description: MPI_Ssend is the synchronous blocking send (the capital 'S' standing for synchronous); it will block until the recipient has received the message. As a blocking send, MPI_Ssend guarantees that the buffer passed can be safely reused once MPI_Ssend returns. Also, this routine may be invoked implicitly by the standard blocking send (MPI_Send). Refer to MPI_Issend to see the non-blocking counterpart of this routine. Other blocking sends are MPI_Send, MPI_Bsend and MPI_Rsend.

Parameters.Name: buffer
Parameters.Description: The buffer to send.

Parameters.Name: count
Parameters.Description: The number of elements to send.

Parameters.Name: datatype
Parameters.Description: The type of one buffer element.

Parameters.Name: recipient
Parameters.Description: The rank of the recipient MPI process.

Parameters.Name: tag
Parameters.Description: The tag to assign to the message.

Parameters.Name: communicator
Parameters.Description: The communicator in which the synchronous send takes place.

Return.Description:
The error code returned from the synchronous send.
- MPI_SUCCESS: the routine successfully completed.
